short_summary: Indigenous knowledge consultation, translation and user training
description: To develop a citizen science portal for sharing PM2.5 exposure data related to biomass smoke from wildfires and wood combustion for home heating, as well as other environmental and social data, in Indigenous, rural and remote communities lacking routine monitoring.

### Tender Details

**Contract ID**: PW-22-01008834
**Tender Closing Date**: October 31, 2022, @ 14:00:00
**Contracting Entity**: Health Canada
**Location**: National Capital Region (NCR)
**Contact**: Sami Nouh (sami.nouh@hc-sc.gc.ca, 613-941-2102)

The government tender announcement, a Request for Proposal (RFP), seeks to obtain specialized services to consult with Indigenous stakeholders, translate community-specific data, and provide user training on a citizen science portal. This portal aims to facilitate the collection and sharing of environmental and social data related to wildfires and indoor air pollution in rural and Indigenous communities.

### Key Requirements

*   Consultation services based on Indigenous knowledge and understanding of community needs
*   Translation services for community-specific data and reports
*   User training for stakeholders on the use and maintenance of the portal

### Eligibility

Eligibility criteria include:

*   Participation in the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   Participation in the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
*   Participation in the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Participation in the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Participation in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Participation in the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

### Submissions

Tender submissions must be made in accordance with the documents supplied by Health Canada (View Documents below). For any queries, please contact Sami Nouh (sami.nouh@hc-sc.gc.ca, 613-941-2102).
